    • This page will be updated frequently with examples, video tutorials, links to new resources, and occasional updates to LAB ASSIGNMENTS. Our schedule follows the Current MHL Academic Calendar. The following topics and their precise order may change. Check here for updates!

    Week 1: 2 April

    Introduction to the BACH library for Computer-Assisted Composition (CAO)

    Start-of-Semester Business

    • Review Syllabus + course policies.
    • Review Software Installation.
    • Review Detailed Breakdown of Grading.

    Listening

    • Hugh Le Caine, Dripsody (1955)
    • Joshua Banks Mailman‘s analysis of Dripsody

    Downloads

    • Interacting With bach.roll boiler patches

    Assignments

    • Install MaxMSP
    • Install the BACH Library
    • (deadline for these installations: Week 2 before class! see our Resources page for instructions)

    Week 2: 9 April

    BACH and Polysynthesis in MaxMSP

    Downloads

    • Bach and poly~ boiler patches

    Listening

    • Goeun talks about her new piece “Into Another”

    Assignments

    • Assign & disucss Final Exam: Mixed Piece with Max Patch
    • Consider the score for Giffen Good (2014) for Trombone and Live Electronics — as an example approach to using Bach for generative notation in a piece of mixed music

    Week 3: 16 April

    Spectral and Microtonal Harmony

    Listening

    • “Nikola Kołodziejczyk’s Instant Ensemble is a response to predictable and repeatable music tours. Sheet music for each concert of the seven-piece band is created live literally in front of the audience, composed in real-time by Nikola” :
    • Claude Vivier, Lonely Child (1980)

    Assignments

    • Assign + discuss the Microphone Cable Coiling Assignment.

    Week 4: 23 April

    No Class!

    Assignments

    • Alternative Proposal Checkpoint

    Week 5: 30 April

    Using Randomness and Distributions

    Downloads

    • Using Randomness and Reservoirs: Boiler Patches

    Listening

    • Shai Cohen, Algorithmic Puzzle (2020) for Piano and Electronics: “By pressing a key, the Markov synthesis moves forward one step. The notation is what the players press…”

    Assignments

    • Assign the Story Curves Project
    • 1st Checkpoint

    Week 6: 7 May

    No Class!

    Assignments

    • Deadline to send + receive XLR Cable Coiling videos.

    Week 7: 14 May

    Real-Time Analysis and Resynthesis

    Tutorials

    • Introduction to <pfft~> Boiler Patches

    Listening

    • Jonathan Bell, Au Commencement (2016) for Choir and Electronics

    Assignments

    • Deadline for Story Curves Project
    • Midterm Exam Checkpoint

    Week 8: 21 May

    No Class!

    Assignments

    • Install MuBu before Week 8 (See Resources page for details…)
    • Hans Tutschku, Shadow of bells (2014) for Piano and Live Electronics
      • Watch all 4 video clips in Hans’ series. Here is Part 1:
    • Part 2
    • Part 3
    • Part 4

    Week 9: 28 May

    Concert Patch Design

    Tutorials

    • MyMagnumOpus Boiler Patch

    Assignments

    • Start assembling and formatting your piece using today’s concert patch template!

    Week 10: 4 June

    Chaotic Attractors

    Definitions

    • Chaos Theory
    • Strange Attractor
    • Thomas’ cyclically symmetric attractor
    • MIT Animation of the Thomas Attractor

    “the trajectory of a frictionally dampened particle moving in a 3D lattice of forces”

    “b corresponds to how dissipative the system is”

    “dt is the time step: larger values means the particles move faster”

    Tutorials

    • List of Strange Attractors + Fractals
    • Chaotic Sounds Video Tutorial

    Downloads

    • Chaotic boiler patches

    Week 11: 11 June

    Introduction to SPAT~ for Multichannel Audio Spatialization

    Assignments

    • Concert Patch Checkpoint

    Week 12: 18 June

    Interpolation of Pitch and Rhythm

    Listening

    • Magnus Lindberg, Joy (1989) for Ensemble and Electronics (excerpts)

    Assignments

    • Tech Rider Deadline

    Week 13: 25 June

    Werkstatt für Aktuelle Musik

    Schedule to be announced…

    Assignments

    • Deadline for Final Exam piece

    Week 14: 2 July

    Mirrors and Fractals: Webern and Risset

    Listening

    • Anton Webern, Variations for Piano, Op. 27 (1936)
    • Jean-Claude Risset, Huit esquisses en duo pour un pianiste (1989)
      • II. Mirrors (2:19)
      • IV. Fractals (5:53)

    Assignments

    Week 15: 9 July

    Advanced FM

    Listening

    • John Chowning, Stria (1977)

    Assignments

    Week 16: n/a

    Granular Synthesis and Bach Slots

    Listening

    • Jakob talks about his installation (ca. 5 min.)
    • Iannis Xenakis, Concret PH (1958)
    • Barry Truax, Riverrun (1986)

    Assignments

    • Debrief Checkpoint

    Week 17: n/a

    No Class!
